verses.kjv: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
verses.ct: From Paul, a prisoner for the sake of Christ Jesus, and from our brother Timothy — to Philemon, our dear friend and coworker,

verses.kjv: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
verses.ct: and to our dear Apphia, and to Archippus who fights alongside us, and to the church that meets in your home:

verses.kjv: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
verses.ct: I always thank my God when I mention you in my prayers,

verses.kjv: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
verses.ct: because I keep hearing about your love and your faith — both your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all of God's people.

verses.kjv: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: My prayer is that the faith you share with others will become even more powerful as you grow in your understanding of every good thing we have in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
verses.ct: Your love has brought me tremendous joy and encouragement, brother, because you have refreshed the hearts of God's people.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
verses.ct: So even though I have every right in Christ to command you to do what needs to be done,

verses.kjv: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: I'd rather appeal to you on the basis of love. I'm making this request as Paul — an old man now, and also a prisoner for Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
verses.ct: I'm appealing to you about Onesimus, who became like a son to me while I was in chains.

verses.kjv: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
verses.ct: There was a time when he was useless to you, but now he has become valuable to both you and me.

verses.kjv: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
verses.ct: I'm sending him back to you — and with him goes my very heart.

verses.kjv: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
verses.ct: I would have loved to keep him here with me so he could serve me on your behalf while I'm imprisoned for the gospel.

verses.kjv: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
verses.ct: But I didn't want to do anything without your agreement, so that any kindness from you would be given freely, not under pressure.

verses.kjv: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
verses.ct: Maybe the reason he was separated from you for a short time was so that you could have him back permanently —

verses.kjv: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
verses.ct: no longer as a slave, but as something far better than a slave: a beloved brother. He is especially dear to me, but how much more should he be to you, both as a person and as a fellow believer in the Lord.

verses.kjv: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
verses.ct: So if you consider me your partner, welcome him the same way you would welcome me.

verses.kjv: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
verses.ct: If he has done you any wrong or owes you anything, charge it to me.

verses.kjv: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
verses.ct: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will pay it back. And I won't even mention that you owe me your very self.

verses.kjv: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
verses.ct: Yes, brother — let me benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

verses.kjv: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
verses.ct: I'm writing to you with full confidence that you will do what I ask — and I know you'll actually go beyond what I'm requesting.

verses.kjv: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
verses.ct: Also, please get a guest room ready for me, because I'm hoping that through your prayers I will be returned to you.

verses.kjv: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
verses.ct: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you his greetings,

verses.kjv: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
verses.ct: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke — my coworkers.

verses.kjv: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.ct: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
